concept.title: Engage Home

audience.otherprops: community engagement officers, project managers, program administrators, public information coordinators, external stakeholders, contractors, agency leadership

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: The Home page displays the list of campaigns and dashboard widgets with their statuses and enables agency users to view a summary and navigate to detailed campaign views.

conbody.p: The Home page displays the list of all available campaigns with their statuses and enables the agency users to view a summary of the campaign details. The project campaigns have the following statuses:

ul.li: During campaign creation, the status of the campaign is in the DRAFT status.
When a campaign in PUBLISHED status is withdrawn, the status of the campaign is changed to the DRAFT status.

row.entry: After the user creates and publishes the campaign for general public participation, the campaign is changed to PUBLISHED status.

A campaign will start receiving comments from the general public during a specified commenting period. The published campaigns during this commenting period will have the ACCEPTING COMMENTS status. Once the commenting period ends, the status of the campaign changes to COMPLETED status.
When you withdraw an ongoing campaign that is in ACCEPTING COMMENTS status, then the status of the campaign is changed to the WITHDRAWN status.
After the commenting period is complete, the campaign is changed to COMPLETED status.
After all the analysis for the completed campaign is done, the status of the campaign can be changed to CLOSED status.

conbody.p: The Search campaigns field enables you to search for appropriate campaigns and view the details of projects associated with them.
The Sort by drop-down list enables you to sort the list of campaigns displayed. The options to sort are as follows:

ul.li: Recently Added – The campaigns are sorted based on the date of creation.
Rating: High to Low – The campaigns are sorted from high to low based on the rating.
Rating: Low to High – The campaigns are sorted from low to high based on the rating.
Most Comments – The campaigns are sorted based on the number of comments.

conbody.p: The Filter option enables you to filter the campaigns based on the following:

ul.li: Campaign Status – You can filter based on the current status of the campaign.
Rating – You can filter based on the campaign rating. The ratings are given by the general public as feedback.
Endorsement % - You can filter based on the endorsement percentage of the campaign.
Comment Period – You can filter based on the commenting period by choosing the start and end date of the commenting period.
